summary: The 'Destruction of Hazardous Imports Act' amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to grant the Secretary of Health and Human Services the authority to destroy imported articles posing a significant public health concern. It expands the scope of destruction to include articles refused admission, and prohibits unauthorized movement of articles the Secretary intends to destroy. The bill mandates regulatory revisions within 90 days of enactment and outlines applicability 180 days thereafter.
